comment: Boring class you have to attend class to get participation and attendence points. Its required to attend 3 performances and 1 has to be off campus! She takes this class very serious and wants participation. Lectures are very boring all you listen to is classical music. I thought this class was a overall music class but its specific to classical.

The professor emphasizes the importance of attendance with iClicker and she opens it for like 30 seconds or a minute at the beginning or end of class. The attendance is especially tricky and frustrating. The tests are easy but the lectures aren't very engaging.

Easy class.Theres six exams throughout the semester and they're 25 questions each. The exams are lockdown browser but no camera.Her lectures just involve her going over powerpoints. You have to attend 3 music performances for a grade.Before an exam, we do test review in class. Attendance is mandatory but she gives you three passes. You'll do great.

I would highly recommend taking this professor, she was very caring and very nice. I took her online class through block scheduling and it was easy. Just a quiz and discussion post every week and a test every couple of weeks. You do have on research paper due which is fairly easy and have to attend 3 concerts for 10% of your grade. Take her!!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: Super easy A and tons of extra credit. Exams are lockdown browser but no camera. The content was boring, but I'm not a music major and just needed the grade. 3 concert assignments, you just need photos for proof, no report or anything. I do hate how the professor did not grade anything until the day grades were due, it made me uneasy all semester.
Extremely boring, but it is an easy grade. If you are interested in music you will like the content, if not then it is an easy grade so I would take the class again.

Professor MacGregor is a very involved, excited lecturer who has a genuine passion for music and its history. She is an easy grader who provides countless opportunities to get extra credit and do well. Her lectures are involved and fun, I learned a lot in her class and it was pretty easy to get an A.

There were many extra credit opportunities with the inquizitive modules, the exams were easy, and the material was very digestible. The discussions were full of substance and allowed me to really highlight my expertise in the field. Overall, if you want an easy yet informative music course, this is the one for you. :)

Prof. MacGregor is a great professor she is very chill and laid back as long as you are respectful and she will always try to help her students. Attendance is mandatory we do "i clicker" for it, and her lectures are very chill. She also does extra credit for exams!
chill class, have additional help sessions if needed but the course is super easy if u just attend the class. Sweet professor, takes actual interest when students bring up other points. Easy A.

This class was a breeze honestly! She has a clear schedule of all assignments so it is hard to miss anything. there are concerts you must attend for a grade, a final project, and exams. She provides a lot of extra credit so take advantage of it.

She had a great d2l. Gives inquisitives for extra credit, DO THEM! They're a super simple way to get extra credit. There's a few of them for every chapter, trust me.. do them! You have a final project which is just a one page prompt. Have to attend 2 KSU concerts and 1 out sourced professional concert. Only 2 exams, not proctored. Loved this class!

She is very nice and emphasizes students' subjectivity in class. Her lectures are interesting, and she often used modern example to help us better understand the concepts. Her tests mirror the content in class, and she offered extra credit that helped prepare for them. So sweet and actually cares about her students.

Take her if you can. One of the nicest professors I ever had. She tries her best to make this class more interesting since it is music in society. Tests are super easy, lockdown browser but no webcam. The only negative thing is she doesn't update her grades often, but she does post midterm grades.

She is a very nice professor! She has a kind and silly personality. Her tests are easy to prepare for, and the textbook isn't required unless you like reading extra, or if you want extra credit. She made this class very interesting!

Here are some things to be aware of. During lectures, she is extremely quiet. However, she typically reads the slides line by line and posts them on D2L, so dont worry about not being able to keep up. You also only need to buy a textbook for extra credit purposes. If you dont care for it, its not required.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Only issue I ever had was her taking a minute to respond to one of my emails. She is very nice, posts great lecture videos, and provides extra credit opportunities for every exam. She even drops your lowest exam grade. The exams do not use webcam. The concert attendance does not have work accompanied with it which is very nice. Take her!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Macgregor is very sweet and nice. She offers a lot of extra credit for each exam, and overall this class is very easy.

She's an amazing teacher and cares about her students. Her class is fun and engaging with group activities and games to prepare you well for exams. She gives 8-12 point extra credit opportunity for each exam.100% recommend her.

She is one of the top 3 teachers I have this semester. She is super nice, super relaxed, everything about her is amazing. We don't have much work assignments in class but make sure you go to class since we do lecture notes almost every day. Extra credit is offered and the tests are super easy.
